memoir:
回忆录 
a written account in which someone (such as a famous performer or politician) describes 
past experiences 
66
alteration:
变更 
the act, process, or result of changing or altering something
fluster:
使惊慌 
to make (someone) nervous and confused
crave:
渴求 
to have a very strong desire for (something)
anguish:
剧痛；极度痛苦；苦恼 
severe pain, mental suffering or unhappiness
depravity:
堕落 
a very evil quality or way of behaving
rugged:
崎岖的 
having a rough, uneven surface

坚强的；坚毅的；吃苦耐劳的 
strong and determined
captive:
被监禁的；被关押的；无法逃离的 
kept as a prisoner or in an enclosed space; unable to escape

囚徒；俘虏；战俘 
a person who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war
masculine:
有男子气概的，阳刚的，男子汉的 
having qualities or appearance traditionally associated with men, especially strength and aggressiveness
sneak:
潜行；偷偷地走 
to move quietly and secretly in order to avoid being noticed

偷拿 
to take or bring (something) secretly and often quickly
resilience:
弹力 
the ability of something to return to its original shape after it has been pulled, stretched, 
pressed, bent, etc.

恢复力 
the ability to become strong, healthy, or successful again after something bad happens
scribble:
潦草地书写 
to write (something) quickly and in a way that makes it difficult to read

潦草写成的东西 
writing that is difficult to read because it has been done quickly or carelessly 
67
venomous:
蛇等分泌毒液的；有毒的 
(of a snake, etc.) producing venom

恶毒的；恶意的；充满仇恨的 
full of bitter feeling or hatred
pact:
条约，契约 
a formal agreement between two countries, people, or groups especially to help each other 
or to stop fighting
traverse:
横过；横越；穿过；横渡 
to cross an area of land or water
decode:
解密 
to change (secret messages, documents, etc.) from a set of letters, numbers, symbols, etc., 
you cannot understand into words you can understand
hilarious:
引人捧腹大笑的；滑稽的；极有趣的 
very funny
extrapolate:
推断 
to form an opinion or to make an estimate about something from known facts
indulge:
使自己沉迷；放纵自己 
to allow oneself to enjoy the pleasure of something, to satisfy or yield freely to (a desire or interest)

听任，纵容 
to be too generous in allowing somebody to have or do whatever they like
commendable:
值得称赞的 
to formally praise someone or something
revelation:
被揭示的真相，新发现；被揭露的内情 
a usually secret or surprising fact that is made known
peek:
一瞥 
a brief look; glance

偷偷地瞥一眼 
to look at someone or something secretly especially from a hidden place 
68
squalid:
肮脏的 
very dirty and unpleasant
objectionable:
令人反感的 
causing people to be offended
haphazard:
偶然的，随意的，无计划的 
having no plan, order, or direction
precocious:
早熟的 
having or showing the qualities or abilities of an adult at an unusually early age
pathogen:
病原体 
something (such as a type of bacteria or a virus) that causes disease
queer:
古怪的，反常的 
odd or unusual
serenity:
平静，宁静 
the quality of being peaceful and calm
liquefy:
溶解，液化 
to cause (something) to become liquid
subterranean:
河流、隧道 地表下的，地下的 
beneath the surface of the earth, underground
dilettante:
业余爱好者 
a person whose interest in an art or in an area of knowledge is not very deep or serious
burial:
埋葬，葬礼 
the act or ceremony of burying a dead person in a grave
unearthly:
怪异的；非自然的 
very strange, unnatural, and frightening
baptize:
洗礼 
to make someone officially a member of the Christian Church in a service of baptism
discrimination:
鉴赏力 
the ability to recognize the difference between things that are of good quality and those that 
are not

歧视 
the practice of unfairly treating a person or group of people differently from other people or 
groups of people 
69
assertive:
断言的，坚定而自信的 
confident in behavior or style
flatter:
奉承 
to praise (someone) in a way that is not sincere
coarse:
皮肤或织物粗糙的；粗织的 
(of skin or fabric) rough; not soft

粗的；不精制的 
consisting of relatively large pieces; not fine

粗鲁无礼的，粗俗的 
rude and offensive
shackle:
给 某人 戴镣铐 
to put shackles on somebody
barbarous:
残酷的；骇人听闻的 
extremely cruel and shocking

缺乏教养的；粗野的 
showing a lack of education and good manners
graze:
擦破 
to injure (the skin, a part of the body, etc.) by scraping against something

吃青草 
to eat grass or other plants that are growing in a field, pasture, etc.
fracture:
破裂 
the result of breaking something; a crack or break

折断 
to cause a crack or break in (something hard, such as a bone)
wretch:
不幸的人；可怜的人 
a person that you feel sympathy or pity for

恶棍；坏蛋；无赖；无耻之徒 
an evil, unpleasant or annoying person
subversive:
破坏性的 
secretly trying to ruin or destroy a government, political system, etc.
prevalence:
流行，盛行 
accepted, done, or happening often or over a large area at a particular time; common or widespread
luminosity:
光明； 恒星等的光度，亮度 
quality or condition of being luminous, brightness; strength of light emitted from a light source 
70
hindsight:
事后聪明，后见之明 
the knowledge and understanding that you have about an event only after it has happened
mortal:
终有一死的；不能永生的 
(of a living human being, often in contrast to a divine being) subject to death

极其严重的；致命的 
causing or liable to cause death; fatal

凡人；肉眼凡胎；普通人 
a human being subject to death, often contrasted with a divine being
charisma:
魅力 
a special charm or appeal that causes people to feel attracted and excited by someone (such 
as a politician)
patron:
艺术家的赞助人，资助者 
a person who gives money and support to artists and writers

名义赞助人支持慈善组织等的名人，名字常用于有关的广告宣传中 
a famous person who supports an organization such as a charity and whose name is used in 
the advertisements, etc. for the organization

老主顾；顾客；常客 
a person who uses a particular shop/store, restaurant, theatre, etc.
merger:
公司、组织等的合并，归并，兼并 
the act or process of combining two or more businesses into one business
melodramatic:
过分严肃的，夸张的，小题大做的 
emotional in a way that is very extreme or exaggerated;extremely dramatic or emotional
ambient:
周围环境的；周围的 
relating to the surrounding area; on all sides

尤指音乐产生轻松氛围的 
especially of music creating a relaxed atmosphere
quantify:
量化 
to find or calculate the quantity or amount of (something)
obsessive:
着迷的，迷恋的，难以释怀的 
thinking about something or someone too much or in a way that is not normal; having an obsession
incompatible:
不兼容的 
not able to exist together without trouble or conflict; not going together well
rectitude:
正直 
the quality of being honest and morally correct 
71
bleak:
阴冷的，冷酷的 
not warm, friendly, cheerful, etc.

无希望的 
not hopeful or encouraging
chasm:
裂口 
a deep hole or opening in the surface of the earth

巨大分歧 
a major division, separation, or difference between two people, groups, etc.
amputate:
截 肢 
to cut off (part of a person's body)
equatorial:
赤道的 
of or relating to the equator; located at or near the equator
monumental:
重要的，意义深远的 
very important

巨大的 
very great or extreme
triumphant:
成功的 
resulting in victory or success 
72
brusque:
无礼的；唐突的 
talking or behaving in a very direct, brief, and unfriendly way
indelible:
难忘的；不可磨灭的 
impossible to remove or forget

擦不掉的 
producing marks that cannot be erased
notorious:
声名狼藉的 
well-known or famous especially for something bad
daunting:
使人畏缩的 
tending to make people afraid or less confident; very difficult to do or deal with
irreconcilable:
不可调和的 
so different that agreement is not possible
antibody:
抗体 
a substance produced by the body to fight disease
ambush:
伏击 
to attack (someone or something) by surprise from a hidden place
mighty:
强有力的 
having or showing great strength or power

极大的，巨大的 
very great
reassure:
使放心 
to make (someone) feel less afraid, upset, or doubtful
evenhanded:
公平无私的 
not favoring one side or group over another
patronage:
赞助 
money and support that is given to an artist, organization, etc.
attachment:
依恋，忠诚 
strong feelings of affection or loyalty for someone or something 
73
assimilate:
吸收 
to learn (something) so that it is fully understood and can be used

同化 
to adopt the ways of another culture; to fully become part of a different society, country, 
etc.
